topics.term_cn: 因果关系 vs. 相关性
topics.definition: Only **Experiments** can prove causation[cite: 6, 88]; **Observational Studies** only show association due to **Confounding Variables**[cite: 8, 87].
A technique to protect privacy when asking **sensitive or illegal** questions by introducing a random mechanism (e.g., coin flip)[cite: 40, 103].
Method to estimate population size ($N$) using the formula: $N = (n \times N_{2}) / n_{T}$[cite: 43, 105].
Avoid **Double-barrelled** (two topics in one) [cite: 27, 70] and **Leading questions** (suggesting a 'correct' answer)[cite: 28, 72].
Both for small datasets; **Stem-and-leaf** is unique because it preserves **original numerical values**[cite: 114, 163].

topics.term_cn: 直方图 vs. 条形图
topics.definition: **Histogram** is for continuous data (no gaps)[cite: 124]; **Bar Chart** is for categorical data (has gaps)[cite: 120, 164].

topics.term_cn: 偏态 (右偏 vs. 左偏)
topics.definition: **Right-skewed**: Tail extends to the right (Mean > Median)[cite: 141, 265]; **Left-skewed**: Tail extends to the left (Mean < Median)[cite: 142, 268].
Based on **Min, Q1, Median, Q3, Max**[cite: 131]. The box height is the **IQR** (Q3 - Q1)[cite: 132, 245].
**Parameter**: Describes population (Greek letters like $\mu, \sigma$)[cite: 186, 226]. **Statistic**: Describes sample (English letters like $\bar{x}, s$)[cite: 189, 226].
Measures not affected by outliers; **Median** and **IQR** are resistant[cite: 204, 218]; **Mean** and **SD** are not[cite: 199, 212].
The square root of variance; measures the average distance of data points from the mean[cite: 222, 248].
Calculated by dividing by **$n-1$** (degrees of freedom) to provide an unbiased estimate of population variance[cite: 223].
